column4: m_newton... your set on him going through the bios... why not just choose the drive once?
matt12.... choose # 3.... watch the status light... make sure you see some activity... if so and it doesnt work you likely have a bad disk.
if no light.. then you must do something else
m_newton.. I do agree with your logic... and from what he has said.. your suggestions "should" have worked...
matt12... get back to the 1.2.3 choices and list them again for us plz
1 resume normal setup 2 enter BIOS Setup Util 3 Choose a temp startup device
okay, I'm testing the live cd on another computer right now
did you fully go though the last steps option 3 then option 1 with the disc in?
yes...the live cd doesnt work from another computer either though
m_newton...should the new live cd work...should I just install ubuntu again? and leave it...or is their a grub repair/remove app on it?
do you dual boot? and does it give you the "press esc for menu" message?
what did you do prior to the issue to possibly "cause" the error?
look for ISOburn on google
I unassigned the partition through windows
which partition?
I killed the ubuntu partition, which killed the grub loader which now won't let me start up
SHAME! on you for trying to ditch ubuntu.
I'm not knowledgable enough to get the most out of ubuntu
I can zip my way around windows easily, but with Ubuntu I was just doing basic stuff.
what are you saying man...am I cooked?
its hard to get "over the hump" with linux
well, I'm learning a lot about my computer right now, that's for sure
yes
